exhibits.title: Barbie: A Cultural Icon Exhibition
exhibits.description: Explore the cultural impact and evolution of the world's most famous fashion doll through decades of design, fashion, and social change.

exhibits.title: New York Pride: The Fight for Marriage Equality
exhibits.description: Chronicles the struggle for marriage equality in New York State, featuring artifacts, photographs, and personal stories from the movement.

exhibits.title: Outcasts: Mary Banning's World of Mushrooms
exhibits.description: Features the remarkable botanical illustrations of Mary Banning, a 19th-century mycologist who documented hundreds of mushroom species in watercolor.

exhibits.title: Holocaust to Haven
exhibits.description: Tells the stories of Holocaust survivors who made their way to New York State, featuring personal artifacts, photographs, and oral histories.

exhibits.title: Berenice Abbott: Changing New York
exhibits.description: Showcases the iconic photographs of Berenice Abbott documenting New York City's transformation during the 1930s.

exhibits.title: A Small Fort, Which Our People Call Fort Orange
exhibits.description: Explores the archaeological history of Fort Orange, the Dutch colonial settlement that predated Albany, through artifacts and historical records.

exhibits.title: Adirondack Wilderness
exhibits.description: An immersive exhibit featuring the natural history, ecology, and wildlife of New York's Adirondack Mountains.

exhibits.title: Beneath the City: An Archaeological Perspective of Albany
exhibits.description: Uncovers Albany's hidden past through archaeological discoveries, revealing centuries of urban development and daily life.

exhibits.title: The World Trade Center: Rescue, Recovery, Response
exhibits.description: A powerful exhibit honoring the heroes of September 11, 2001, featuring artifacts from Ground Zero and stories of rescue and recovery.

exhibits.title: Historic Carousel
exhibits.description: Ride the museum's fully restored early 20th century Spillman carousel, a beloved family attraction.

exhibits.title: From the Hudson to the Nile: Dows Dunham and the Archaeology of Egypt and Sudan
exhibits.description: Explores the career of Egyptologist Dows Dunham and his excavations, featuring artifacts from ancient Egypt and Sudan.

exhibits.title: Joan Steiner's Look-Alikes
exhibits.description: Interactive exhibit featuring intricate three-dimensional scenes constructed from everyday objects. The more you look, the more you see!

exhibits.title: Blanche Lazzell: Becoming an American Modernist
exhibits.description: Explores the work of Blanche Lazzell, a pioneering American modernist known for her white-line woodcuts and abstract paintings.

exhibits.title: A Life in Bloom: The Floral Paintings of Julia McEntee Dillon
exhibits.description: Features the delicate floral still-life paintings of Julia McEntee Dillon, a Kingston-born artist known for her botanical works.

exhibits.title: The Hudson River School: Landscape Paintings from the Albany Institute
exhibits.description: One of the largest collections of Hudson River School paintings, including works by Thomas Cole, Frederic Church, and other masters of American landscape painting.

exhibits.title: Ancient Egypt
exhibits.description: Permanent exhibition featuring Egyptian mummies, artifacts, and objects from the Albany Institute's renowned collection.

exhibits.title: Traders and Culture: Colonial Albany and the Formation of American Identity
exhibits.description: Explores Albany's role as a colonial trading center and its influence on the development of American culture and identity.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: All These Growing Things
exhibits.description: Year-long exhibition exploring questions of becoming and belonging through paintings, prints, textiles, photography, and sculpture. Organized around four themes: Ancestries, Masks, Transformations, and Hybrids.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: Family Forms
exhibits.description: Explores diverse representations of family structures and relationships through contemporary art.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: Sheila Pepe: When & Where We Rest
exhibits.description: Site-specific installation by artist Sheila Pepe exploring themes of rest, community, and domestic space.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: Hyde Cabinet #30: Analyze This
exhibits.description: Intimate exhibition in the museum's Hyde Cabinet gallery space.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: Building Blocks
exhibits.description: Interactive atrium installation exploring architectural forms and spatial relationships.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: Kathy Butterly: Assume Yes
exhibits.description: First museum survey of ceramic artist Kathy Butterly, known for her small-scale, vibrantly colored sculptural vessels.

exhibits.museum_full: Tang Teaching Museum at Skidmore College
exhibits.title: Inked: Stigma, Otherness, and Art
exhibits.description: Online exhibition exploring the cultural history and artistic significance of tattoos and body art.

exhibits.title: 21st Annual Members' Show
exhibits.description: Annual juried exhibition featuring work from local and regional artists, with over $2,000 in cash prizes awarded.

exhibits.museum_full: The Arts Center of the Capital Region
exhibits.title: Bernice Bornt: Silk-screen Posters for the Arts
exhibits.description: Retrospective of silk-screen posters created by artist Bernice Bornt for arts organizations throughout the Capital Region.

exhibits.museum_full: The Arts Center of the Capital Region
exhibits.title: CONVERSATIONS
exhibits.description: Group exhibition exploring dialogue and connection through various artistic media.

exhibits.title: Guided Ship Tours
exhibits.description: Walk in the footsteps of heroes aboard the last destroyer escort afloat in America. Restored to its 1945 configuration, experience life aboard a WWII warship with veteran guides.

exhibits.title: Stem to Stern Tour
exhibits.description: Extended 2-hour tour covering the entire ship including the Engine Room and Collections Space. See the diesel electric propulsion system and artifacts from destroyer escorts.

exhibits.title: The Great Famine Exhibition
exhibits.description: Exhibit from the Quinnipiac Famine museum featuring sculptures, paintings, and photographs depicting the Irish Famine of 1845-1853.

exhibits.title: The Irish in America
exhibits.description: Comprehensive exhibition showcasing Irish contributions to founding America, including labor, military service, education, religion, politics, culture, sport, and innovation.

exhibits.title: Thatched Cottage & Tenement Apartment
exhibits.description: Experience replica living spaces that illustrate the conditions Irish immigrants left behind and what they found in America.

exhibits.title: Iron & Innovation: Troy's Industrial Heritage
exhibits.description: Located in the former Burden Iron Works office, this museum tells the story of ironworking in South Troy and the region's transformation into the 'Silicon Valley' of the 19th century. Features artifacts including Civil War-era armor from the USS Monitor.
